required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Losartan in Pediatric Patients With Hypertension (MK-0954-337)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Open-Label, Parallel-Group, Dose-Ranging Clinical Trial to Study the Safety and Efficacy of MK954/Losartan Potassium in Pediatric Patients With Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study will explore the dose-response of losartan as well as the safety and tolerability in children from 6 months to 6 years of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
primary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure ([BP] or supine if child could not sit) was measured after the participant had been seated for 5 minutes with back supported, feet on the floor and right arm (or left arm if it was the customary side for BP measurement for the patient) supported at heart level. Systolic BP was determined by averaging 3 replicate measurements obtained at least 1 minute apart.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported 1 or More Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Event(s)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 weeks (Base Study); up to 24 months (Extension)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Discontinued From Study Due to a Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 weeks (Base Study); up to 24 months (Extension)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting BP (or supine if child could not sit) was measured after the participant had been seated for 5 minutes with back supported, feet on the floor and right arm (or left arm if it was the customary side for BP measurement for the patient) supported at heart level. Diastolic BP was determined by averaging 3 replicate measurements obtained at least 1 minute apart.

arm_group.description: Open-label losartan at starting dose of 0.1 mg/kg/day with uptitration at Weeks 3, 6, or 9 to the next highest dose level if blood pressure goal not achieved
Open-label losartan at starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg/day with uptitration at Weeks 3, 6, or 9 to the next highest dose level if blood pressure goal not achieved
Open-label losartan at starting dose of 0.7 mg/kg/day with uptitration at Weeks 3, 6, or 9 to the next highest dose level if blood pressure goal not achieved

intervention.description: losartan potassium, dry powder, to be suspended in liquid and given orally, once daily; doses will start at 0.1 mg/kg, 0.3 mg/kg, and 0.7 mg/kg, respectively, in the three study arms and can be escalated up to 1.4 mg/kg (maximum dose 100 mg) until target blood pressure is reached.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant is determined to be hypertensive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has a history of severe or symptomatic hypertension
- Participant has history of heart failure, rhythm disturbance or cardiomyopathy, or obstructive valvular disease
- Participant has started taking hypertensive medications within the past 30 days
- Participant has a known sensitivity to losartan or history of angioneurotic edema

link.description: Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

results_reference.citation: Webb NJ, Wells TG, Shahinfar S, Massaad R, Dankner WM, Lam C, Santoro EP, McCrary Sisk C, Blaustein RO. A randomized, open-label, dose-response study of losartan in hypertensive children. Clin J Am Soc Nephrol. 2014 Aug 7;9(8):1441-8. doi: 10.2215/CJN.11111113. Epub 2014 May 29.

group.title: Losartan Potassium 0.1 to 1.4 mg/kg

group.title: Losartan Potassium-Extension
group.description: Participants who elected to enter extension; dose level of Losartan was that which was being administered at end of base study

participants_list.participants: 7 participants who completed base study opted not to enter extension

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure ([BP] or supine if child could not sit) was measured after the participant had been seated for 5 minutes with back supported, feet on the floor and right arm (or left arm if it was the customary side for BP measurement for the patient) supported at heart level. Systolic BP was determined by averaging 3 replicate measurements obtained at least 1 minute apart.
outcome.population: Analysis performed using the Full Analysis Set defined as all randomized participants who had at least 1 dose of study drug, had baseline data, and had a post-treatment endpoint observation

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Sitting blood pressure ([BP] or supine if child could not sit) was measured after the participant had been seated for 5 minutes with back supported, feet on the floor and right arm (or left arm if it was the customary side for BP measurement for the patient) supported at heart level. Systolic BP was determined by averaging 3 replicate measurements obtained at least 1 minute apart.
measure.population: Analysis performed using the Full Analysis Set defined as all randomized participants who had at least 1 dose of study drug, had baseline data, and had a post-treatment endpoint observation

analysis.method_desc: Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model with terms for dose, weight (as a continuous covariate) and presence of co-morbidities/end organ damage

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported 1 or More Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Event(s)
outcome.time_frame: up to 12 weeks (Base Study); up to 24 months (Extension)
outcome.population: All Patients as Treated Population, which consisted of all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Adverse events for the base study were reported by the dose taken at the time of the event and not the study group to which they were randomly assigned. Adverse events for the study extension were reported as 1 arm.

reported_events.time_frame: up to 12 weeks (Base Study); up to 24 months (Extension)
reported_events.desc: Serious and Non-serious adverse events are reported by the dose taken at the time of the event and not the study group to which they were randomly assigned. A participant may have reported a serious/adverse event when taking different dose levels and therefore may have been counted more than once.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lip and/or oral cavity cancer stage III

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Subsequent to the multicenter publication, or 24 months after completion of the study, whichever comes first, an investigator and/or his/her colleagues may publish the results for their study site independently. The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
